question:
Closed. This question is off-topic. It is not currently accepting answers.
                                
                            











 This question does not appear to be about quantum computing or quantum information, within the scope defined in the help center.


Closed last year.







                        Improve this question
                    



I am just getting started with using Qiskit and I am trying to run some processes using the qiskit.finance package (I am basically following along the portfolio optimization tutorial found here). However, when I try to import the package, I get the following error message:
ImportError: cannot import name 'BaseBackend' from 'qiskit.providers'
It seems that it is likely an issue with Qiskit Aqua since that has since been deprecated and broken up into specific applications, algorithms, etc.
I tried creating a new environment and starting with a fresh install of Qiskit, but that also led to the same error. Is anyone else having this issue? Thanks!
The full error message is:

answers: The latest version of the Finance tutorials are here https://qiskit.org/documentation/finance/tutorials/index.html I suggest starting there where you will find an updated version of the one you referenced, which is quite old now from an earlier version of qiskit (0.24). You say you are just getting started, installing the newer versions of Qiskit do not install Aqua, since as you noticed code was refactored into core qiskit and separate application repos.
comments: I’m voting to close this question because it does not require knowledge about Quantum Computing to be answered. As such, it should be either askep on StackOverflow, or on the dedicated Qiskit Slack channel
